result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hope Suzanne Chambers

records.addlTxt: Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be subjected to drug testing to be administered by Trempealeau County Department of Human Services immediately upon their request.
Attorney Kuczynski advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. PLEAS set. Bond cont.

Defendant Hope Suzanne Chambers in court, in custody from TC Jail.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Hope Suzanne Chambers.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. State calls witness, Deputy R. Huson, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense has no questions for witness. State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause. BOT. State filed an information, counts track complaint.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be subjected to drug testing to be administered by Trempealeau County Department of Human Services immediately upon their request.

1:03 PM Defendant Hope Suzanne Chambers appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared by phone for Hope Suzanne Chambers.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant makes statement regarding non-appearance. Defendant turned self in. State requests to amend bond to $125 each case if has not been forfeited. Defense requests to reinstate bond, makes argument. Court advised bond was forfeited. Court reinstates bond but adds an additional $125 each case to equal $1,000. PH set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.
